Description: Rim fragment of an Attic black-glazed pottery cup Type C. Graffito ]nipaios[. Fifth century BC.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The find-spot noted in Hogarth's diary for 18th April 1903.
Bibliographic references: Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 118, no. 19, pl. 14.S)
CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p.58, pl. 43,5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1452)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1896-1908-G.141.7 (old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
